README contain badges continuous integration services used package. recommend tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: cde: a run through
text: Within Europe, Water Framework Directive (WFD) sets EU-wide standards quality surface- ground-waters across Europe assessed classified. Assessment quality using WFD based range elements vary depending type water assessed combined give overall classification waterbodies five classes (High, Good, Moderate, Poor Bad) surface waters two classes (Good Poor) groundwaters. UK Environment Agency (EA) competent authority responsible monitoring assessment water quality within England. EA made reporting data relating requirements WFD available via Catchment Data Explorer (CDE) website, https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/. cde package R facilitates searching download WFD reporting data waterbodies EA CDE website. types data can downloaded : WFD status classification data, Reasons Achieving Good (RNAG) status, objectives set waterbodies details associated protected areas. CDE data made available Open Government Licence v3.0 use data accessed contained within package implies acceptance licence conditions.

title: cde: a run through
text: can install current development version github :
code: # if you have not done so already # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/cde")

title: cde: a run through
text: search_sites function allows search waterbodies, Operational Management Catchments River Basin Districts contain match partial match specified search string (case-sensitive). hierarchical relationship waterbodies, catchments River Basin Districts (RBD) shown . example, search waterbodies containing name “Lark”. dataframe returned contains details waterbodies containing string “Lark” name. details returned include waterbody id codes (WBID), type waterbody, Operational Management Catchment names River Basin District. search Operational Catchments containing string use following code.
code: # load the package library(cde)  # search for waterbodies containing the name "Lark" lark_wb<-search_names(string="Lark", column="name") # show the top 6 rows of the 'name' column head(lark_wb$name) #> [1] "Lark (US Hawstead)"                    #> [2] "Lark downstream of Mill Street Bridge" #> [3] "Lark (Hawstead to Abbey Gardens)"      #> [4] "Lark (Abbey Gardens to Mildenhall)"    #> [5] "Lark"                                  #> [6] "Lark - Fynn (d/s confluence)" lark_oc<-search_names(string="Lark", column="OC")

title: cde: a run through
text: located waterbody, catchment River Basin District want retrieve data , can use get_status function retrieve status classification information CDE website. can extract data specific year, range years. Operational/Management Catchment River Basin District level downloads, can also extract information just specific waterbody type (rivers) waterbody types. addition possible extract classification data relating specific element classification. overall classification made number different elements hierarchy. Details hierarchy classification levels can found . default retrieves “Overall Water Body”” classification status, specifying level, information specific level classification can retrieved. possible values : function returns object class cde_df (basically dataframe custom print plot methods) containing status (details) specified combination column, value, level dates. Note 2013 2014 waterbodies classified Cycle 1 Cycle 2 methodologies. status information extracted years just Cycle 2 classification, avoid double counting. also change environmental standards applied chemical aspects status assessment cycles, may noticeable changes status years. See details. details meaning different columns returned, see output reference list. example higher level download, specifying year range type (case Rivers). get information status classification relation specific level classification, can specify level well (see table options details classification levels used).
code: # extract overall waterbody status classification data for a single  # waterbody in all years  # first decide which waterbody, we can use one from the first search  # above (need the WBID information) head(lark_wb) #>                WBID                                  name  type    OC #> 1911 GB105033042920                    Lark (US Hawstead) River  Lark #> 1912 GB105033043052 Lark downstream of Mill Street Bridge River  Lark #> 1914 GB105033042940      Lark (Hawstead to Abbey Gardens) River  Lark #> 1918 GB105033043051    Lark (Abbey Gardens to Mildenhall) River  Lark #> 2197 GB105035040360                                  Lark River Deben #> 2200 GB105035040300          Lark - Fynn (d/s confluence) River Deben #>                    MC     RBD #> 1911 Cam and Ely Ouse Anglian #> 1912 Cam and Ely Ouse Anglian #> 1914 Cam and Ely Ouse Anglian #> 1918 Cam and Ely Ouse Anglian #> 2197     East Suffolk Anglian #> 2200     East Suffolk Anglian  # we will get data for the first waterbody here (WBID: GB105033042920,  # name: Lark (US Hawstead)) lark_hawstead<-get_status(ea_name="GB105033042920", column="WBID")  # the dataframe returned contains all of the data for this site in all  # years (we did not specify year/year range). lark_hawstead #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #> With an additional 17 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.  # just a quick look at the actual status data table(lark_hawstead$status) #>  #>     Good Moderate  #>        1        9 # download status data for a given year range and type of waterbody lark_OC_rivers<-get_status(ea_name="Lark", column="OC", startyr=2013, endyr=2015, type="River") # print out the results lark_OC_rivers #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #>               Anglian     Cam and Ely Ouse                  Lark #> With an additional 26 rows and 17 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console. # download Chemical status for rivers in all years lark_OC_rivers_chem<-get_status(ea_name="Lark", column="OC", type="River", level="Chemical")

title: cde: a run through
text: get_status function, along get_... functions, plot method provides quick overview plots status classes, giving plot percentages waterbodies different status classes combination criteria specified. Plotting possible Operational/Management Catchment River Basin District downloads.  plots, colour scheme used based viridis palette. get_status get_objectives alternative colour scheme, based WFD-defined status class colours, can used instead setting scheme="wfd" within plot call. Also single year specified, standard (opposed stacked) barplot produced shown .
code: # get overall waterbody status information for the Lark OC between 2013 and 2015 lark_OC_2013_15 <- get_status(ea_name="Lark", column="OC", startyr=2013, endyr=2015) # plot the data plot(lark_OC_2013_15) # get the overall waterbody status information for rivers in the Lark OC in 2015 lark_OC_rivers_2015 <- get_status(ea_name="Lark", column="OC", startyr=2015, type="River") # plot these data, using WFD colour scheme plot(lark_OC_rivers_2015, scheme="wfd")

what: Reasons for Not Achieving Good status
title: cde: a run through
text: waterbodies Lark Operational Catchment example achieved Good status. get_rnag function downloads Reasons Achieving Good (RNAG) data, allow us find detail pressures waterbodies assessed driving failure. RNAG data can extracted specific classification levels, per status data . details meaning different columns returned, see output reference list. Plots RNAG data given frequency histograms occurence information pressure_tier_3 column. details , see reference list.
code: # what are the RNAG for the Lark OC lark_OC_RNAG <- get_rnag(ea_name="Lark", column="OC") # plot RNAG data for the Lark OC plot(lark_OC_RNAG)

title: cde: a run through
text: waterbodies less Good status, objectives set indicate status aimed longer term. objectives set relation determined achievable given timescale. Therefore objectives set relation 6-year cycle assessment (years 2015, 2021 2027, also 2040 2050 long-term objectives). Using get_objectives function, can download objectives waterbodies, catchments River Basin Districts. Objectives can downloaded specific year (2015, 2021, 2027, 2040 2050), level classification waterbody type per get_status function. Note however waterbodies objectives set years, levels types. objectives set criteria specified, message given. details meaning different columns returned, see output reference list. Plotting objectives similar get_status data, except status classes represent target objectives predicted achieved date specified.
code: # download the objectives set for 2015 for the Lark Operational Catchment lark_OC_obj_2015<-get_objectives(ea_name="Lark", column="OC", year=2015) # plot the objectives for the Lark OC in 2015 plot(lark_OC_obj_2015)

title: cde: a run through
text: get_pa function downloads details protected areas associated waterbody, catchment River Basin District. protected areas listed include designated conservation reasons, SACs (Habitats Species Directive), pollution reduction, Nitrate Vulnerable Zones (Nitrates Directive) human use (Bathing Water Directive). details meaning different columns returned, see output reference list. Plotting output get_pa produces frequency histogram protected_area_type column within area specified.
code: # get details of the protected areas within the Lark Operational Catchment lark_OC_pa<-get_pa(ea_name="Lark", column="OC") plot(lark_OC_pa)

title: Download Data from the Catchment Data Explorer Website
text: Within Europe, Water Framework Directive (WFD) sets EU-wide standards quality surface- ground-waters across Europe assessed classified. Assessment quality using WFD based range elements vary depending type water assessed combined give overall classification waterbodies five classes (High, Good, Moderate, Poor Bad) surface waters two classes (Good Poor) groundwaters. UK Environment Agency (EA) competent authority responsible monitoring assessment water quality within England. EA made reporting data relating requirements WFD available via Catchment Data Explorer (CDE) website, https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/. cde package R facilitates searching download WFD reporting data waterbodies EA CDE website. ability access data within R environment allows efficient collation interrogation data reproducible analysis trends patterns water quality pressures waterbodies across England. also inconsistencies way data structured within original CDE website; cde provides consistently named structured output facilitates analysis. types data can downloaded : WFD status classification data, Reasons Achieving Good (RNAG) status, objectives set waterbodies details associated protected areas. CDE data made available Open Government Licence v3.0 use data accessed contained within package implies acceptance licence conditions.

what: cde: Download Data from the Catchment Data Explorer Website — cde-package
title: cde: Download Data from the Catchment Data Explorer Website — cde-package
text: Facilitates searching, download plotting Water Framework Directive (WFD) reporting data waterbodies within UK Environment Agency area. types data can downloaded : WFD status classification data, Reasons Achieving Good (RNAG) status, objectives set waterbodies, measures put place improve water quality details associated protected areas. site accessed https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/. data made available Open Government Licence v3.0 https://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/.

title: cde: Download Data from the Catchment Data Explorer Website — cde-package
text: Maintainer: Rob Briers r.briers@napier.ac.uk (ORCID)

what: cde: Download Water Framework Directive (WFD) data from the Environment Agency Catchment Data Explorer (CDE) website. — cde
title: cde: Download Water Framework Directive (WFD) data from the Environment Agency Catchment Data Explorer (CDE) website. — cde
text: Facilitates searching download WFD-related data waterbodies within Environment Agency area (.e. England). types data can downloaded : WFD status classification data, Reasons Achieving Good (RNAG) status, objectives set waterbodies, details associated protected areas. Default plots can also produced thedata downloaded (form plot depends data type).

what: Details of name and index of all sites/catchments. — ea_wbids
title: Details of name and index of all sites/catchments. — ea_wbids
text: Dataframe used `cde` construct API calls. data included made available Open Government Licence v3.0 https://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/. Use data accessed contained within package implies acceptance licence conditions.

title: Details of name and index of all sites/catchments. — ea_wbids
code: ea_wbids

title: Details of name and index of all sites/catchments. — ea_wbids
text: data frame 5237 rows 9 variables: WBID identifier individual waterbodies name detailed name site/catchment type type waterbody (River, Lake etc.) OC Operational Catchment name OC_num Index number Operational Catchment MC Management Catchment name MC_num Index number Management Catchment RBD River Basin District name RBD_num Index number River Basin District details hierarchy different catchment types, see https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/help#help-catchment-hierarchy

title: Details of name and index of all sites/catchments. — ea_wbids
text: https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/

what: Retrieve Objectives set for waterbodies — get_objectives
title: Retrieve Objectives set for waterbodies — get_objectives
text: Retrieves details objectives set waterbodies terms predicted classification EA Catchment Data Explorer site. Data can retrieved specifying waterbody id (WBID), Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD). Start year (startyr) end year (endyr) allow specific timeranges downloaded. Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD) level downloads, waterbody type can also specified allow extraction specific waterbody types (River, Lake etc).

title: Retrieve Objectives set for waterbodies — get_objectives
code: get_objectives(   ea_name = NULL,   column = NULL,   level = "Overall Water Body",   year = NULL,   type = NULL )

title: Retrieve Objectives set for waterbodies — get_objectives
text: ea_name string representing description (name OC, MC RBD level downloads WBID individual waterbodies) features extracted. example extract data whole Humber RBD, "Humber"; also see examples. Must exact match values used EA database. Use search_names function search specific values. column column searched. Possible options WBID (waterbody id), OC (Operational Catchment), MC (Management Catchment) RBD (River Basin District) level level within WFD quality classification elements objectives set . full details hierarchy elements within classification used, see https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/help#help-classification-hierarchy. Defaults 'Overall Water Body'. Possible values different levels retrieved function shown . year year objectives set , either 2015, 2021, 2027, 2040 2050. given objectives years returned. Note objectives may set years. type Type waterbody extracted. Operational/Management catchment level RBD level queries, data can also subset waterbody type. Possible values River, Lake, GroundWaterBody, TransitionalWater CoastalWater.

title: Retrieve Objectives set for waterbodies — get_objectives
text: object class cde_df containing details objectives set specified set waterbodies. details meaning different columns returned, see https://docs.ropensci.org/cde/articles/cde-output-reference.html.

title: Retrieve Objectives set for waterbodies — get_objectives
code: # get all objectives set for waterbody GB112071065700 get_objectives(ea_name="GB112071065700", column="WBID") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment water_body #>            North West               Ribble            Big Ribble Duddel Bro #> With an additional 13 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.   # get the objectives set for Lakes in the Humber RBD, for the year 2021 get_objectives(ea_name="Humber", column="RBD", year=2021, type="Lake") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment water_body #>                Humber       Idle and Torne            Idle River Welbeck Gr #>                Humber Wharfe and Ouse Lowe Wharfe Middle and Was Swinsty Re #>                Humber Trent Valley Staffor Penk Rivers and Lakes Belvide Re #>                Humber Swale Ure Nidd and O            Nidd Upper Gouthwaite #> With an additional 13 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.   # get the objectives set for Rivers in the Avon Warwickshire # Management Catchment in relation to Chemical status get_objectives(ea_name="Avon Warwickshire", column="MC", level="Chemical", type="River") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment water_body #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Elmley Cas #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Mary Bk -  #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Harvington #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Broadway-B #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Swilgate - #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Piddle Bk  #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Bretforton #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Littleton  #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Whitsunn B #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Bourne Bk  #> With an additional 65 rows and 13 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.

title: Retrieve Protected Area Information — get_pa
text: Retrieves details Protected Areas associated waterbodies, catchments River Basin Districts EA Catchment Data Explorer site. Data can retrieved specifying waterbody id (WBID), Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD).

title: Retrieve Protected Area Information — get_pa
code: get_pa(ea_name = NULL, column = NULL)

title: Retrieve Protected Area Information — get_pa
text: ea_name string representing description (name OC, MC RBD level downloads WBID individual waterbodies) features extracted. example extract data whole Humber RBD, "Humber"; also see examples. Must exact match values used EA database. Use search_names function search specific values. column column searched. Possible options WBID (waterbody id), OC (Operational Catchment), MC (Management Catchment) RBD (River Basin District)

title: Retrieve Protected Area Information — get_pa
text: object class cde_df containing details Protected Areas associated waterbodies. details meaning different columns returned, see https://docs.ropensci.org/cde/articles/cde-output-reference.html.

Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - what: Retrieve Reasons for Not Achieving Good Status — get_rnag
title: Retrieve Reasons for Not Achieving Good Status — get_rnag
text: Retrieves details Reasons Achieving Good (RNAG) status Reasons Failure (RFF) EA Catchment Data Explorer site. Data can retrieved specifying waterbody id (WBID), Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD). Start year (startyr) end year (endyr) allow specific timeranges downloaded. Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD) level downloads, waterbody type can also specified allow extraction specific waterbody types (River, Lake etc). Data presented level individual elements reasons achieving good status.

title: Retrieve Reasons for Not Achieving Good Status — get_rnag
code: get_rnag(ea_name = NULL, column = NULL, type = NULL)

title: Retrieve Reasons for Not Achieving Good Status — get_rnag
text: ea_name string representing description (name OC, MC RBD level downloads WBID individual waterbodies) features extracted. example extract data whole Humber RBD, "Humber"; also see examples. Must exact match values used EA database. Use search_names function search specific values. column column searched. Possible options WBID (waterbody id), OC (Operational Catchment), MC (Management Catchment) RBD (River Basin District) type Type waterbody extracted. Operational/Management catchment level RBD level queries, data can also subset waterbody type. Possible values River, Lake, GroundWaterBody, TransitionalWater CoastalWater.

title: Retrieve Reasons for Not Achieving Good Status — get_rnag
text: object class cde_df containing details Reasons Achieving Good Status specified combination criteria. details meaning different columns returned, see https://docs.ropensci.org/cde/articles/cde-output-reference.html.

title: Retrieve Reasons for Not Achieving Good Status — get_rnag
code: # get all RNAG issues identified for waterbody GB112071065700 get_rnag("GB112071065700", "WBID") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment water_body #>            North West               Ribble            Big Ribble Duddel Bro #>            North West               Ribble            Big Ribble Duddel Bro #>            North West               Ribble            Big Ribble Duddel Bro #>            North West               Ribble            Big Ribble Duddel Bro #> With an additional 24 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.   # get the RNAG issues for Lakes in the Humber RBD, between # 2013 and 2014 get_rnag(ea_name="Humber", column="RBD", type="Lake") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment water_body #>                Humber Louth Grimsby and An              Ancholme Cadney Res #>                Humber Louth Grimsby and An              Ancholme Cadney Res #>                Humber Louth Grimsby and An              Ancholme Cadney Res #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain Hornsea Me #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain Hornsea Me #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain Hornsea Me #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain Hornsea Me #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain Hornsea Me #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain Hornsea Me #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain Hornsea Me #> With an additional 540 rows and 24 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.   # get the RNAG issues for Rivers in the Avon Warwickshire # Management Catchment get_rnag(ea_name="Avon Warwickshire", column="MC", type="River") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment water_body #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Piddle Bk  #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Bow Bk - s #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West Carrant Bk #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - what: Retrieve WFD Status Classification Data — get_status
title: Retrieve WFD Status Classification Data — get_status
text: Retrieves WFD Status classification data EA Catchment Data Explorer site. Data can retrieved specifying waterbody id (WBID), Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD). Start year (startyr) end year (endyr) allow specific timeranges downloaded. Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD) level downloads, waterbody type can also specified allow extraction specific waterbody types (River, Lake etc).

title: Retrieve WFD Status Classification Data — get_status
code: get_status(   ea_name = NULL,   column = NULL,   level = "Overall Water Body",   startyr = NULL,   endyr = NULL,   type = NULL )

title: Retrieve WFD Status Classification Data — get_status
text: ea_name string representing description (name OC, MC RBD level downloads WBID individual waterbodies) features extracted. example extract data whole Humber RBD, "Humber"; also see examples. Must exact match values used EA database. Use search_names function search specific values. column column searched. Possible options WBID (waterbody id), OC (Operational Catchment), MC (Management Catchment) RBD (River Basin District) level level within WFD quality classification elements objectives set . full details hierarchy elements within classification used, see https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/help/usage#catchment-hierarchy. Defaults 'Overall Water Body'. Possible values different levels retrieved function shown . startyr data can extracted specific years using startyr endyr arguments. startyr specified extracts particular year. years specified years returned. endyr data can extracted specific years using startyr endyr arguments. endyr specified startyr also included, otherwise error returned. type Type waterbody extracted. Operational/Management catchment level RBD level queries, data can also subset waterbody type. Possible values River, Lake, GroundWaterBody, TransitionalWater CoastalWater.

title: Retrieve WFD Status Classification Data — get_status
text: object class cde_df containing classification details specified combination criteria. details meaning different columns returned, see https://docs.ropensci.org/cde/articles/cde-output-reference.html.

title: Retrieve WFD Status Classification Data — get_status
code: # get Overall Water Body status classification for waterbody GB520804714300 get_status(ea_name="GB520804714300", column="WBID") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #> With an additional 17 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.   # get status class based on Priority substances for waterbody GB520804714300 get_status(ea_name="GB520804714300", column="WBID", level="Priority substances") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #>            South West      South West TraC         Tamar Estuary #> With an additional 1 rows and 17 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.   # get the Overall Water Body status of Lakes in the Humber RBD, between # 2012 and 2014 get_status(ea_name="Humber", column="RBD", startyr=2012, endyr=2014, type="Lake") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment #>                Humber Louth Grimsby and An              Ancholme #>                Humber Louth Grimsby and An              Ancholme #>                Humber Louth Grimsby and An              Ancholme #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain #>                Humber Hull and East Riding    Barmston Sea Drain #>                Humber Trent Valley Staffor Blithe Rivers and Lak #>                Humber Trent Valley Staffor Blithe Rivers and Lak #>                Humber Trent Valley Staffor Blithe Rivers and Lak #>                Humber                 Dove Churnet Rivers and La #> With an additional 380 rows and 17 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.   # get the Overall Water Body status for Rivers in the Avon Warwickshire # Operational Catchment in 2011 get_status(ea_name="Avon Warwickshire", column="MC", startyr=2011, type="River") #>  river_basin_district management_catchment operational_catchment #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #>                Severn    Avon Warwickshire  Avon - Midlands West #> With an additional 59 rows and 17 columns of data.  #> Row values may be truncated to fit console.

what: Plot method for cde_df output — plot.cde_df
title: Plot method for cde_df output — plot.cde_df
text: Default plots output main get_ functions. Details plots different data given . status objectives produces (stacked)  percentage barplot waterbody observed predicted (objective)  status information given set data. rnag, measures pa produces frequency histogram. columns plotted data type given : rnag   (pressure_tier_3) measures   (measure_category_1) pa   (protected_area_type) full detail different data plotted can found EA Catchment Data Explorer API reference: https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/ui/reference Plotting possible MC, OC RBD downloads.

title: Plot method for cde_df output — plot.cde_df
code: # S3 method for class 'cde_df' plot(x, ...)

title: Plot method for cde_df output — plot.cde_df
text: x object class cde_df plotted. ... arguments passed individual methods. argument implemented present scheme. status objectives data defines colour scheme use plots. defaults viridis-based scheme (scheme="vir"). Alternatively, colours specified WFD document can used specifying scheme="wfd".

title: Print method for cde_df — print.cde_df
text: Custom print method objects class cde_df. Formats output fit current width console, keeping full column names truncating row values required.

title: Print method for cde_df — print.cde_df
code: # S3 method for class 'cde_df' print(x, ...)

title: Print method for cde_df — print.cde_df
text: x object class cde_df. ... arguments passed individual methods. None implemented present.

what: Search database of site names — search_names
title: Search database of site names — search_names
text: Searches listing EA monitoring sites find rows contain string provided. Can search WBID (WBID), name (name), Management Catchment (MC), Operational Catchment (OC) River Basin District (RBD). hierarchical relationship levels shown https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/help#help-catchment-hierarchy. search done local copy waterbody listing contained ea_wbids object rather connecting EA site.

title: Search database of site names — search_names
code: search_names(string = NULL, column = NULL)

title: Search database of site names — search_names
text: string search string matched (case-sensitive). match whole partial strings column values. column column searched. Possible options WBID, name, OC (Operational Catchment), MC (Management Catchment) RBD (River Basin District)

title: Search database of site names — search_names
text: data frame containing details sites match search string (full partial matches) column specified. Columns returned defined ea_wbids.

title: Search database of site names — search_names
code: # search for sites containing "Tadnoll" in the name search_names(string="Tadnoll", column="name") #>                WBID                                    name  type #> 3694 GB108044009660 Tadnoll Brook (including Empool Bottom) River #>                        OC     MC        RBD #> 3694 Poole Harbour Rivers Dorset South West  # search for Operational Catchments containing "Cornwall" search_names(string="Cornwall", column="OC") #>                WBID           name        type                     OC #> 3544 GB610807680002 Cornwall North     Coastal Cornwall North Coastal #> 3567 GB620806570000 Cornwall South     Coastal Cornwall South Coastal #> 3763 GB40802G800300 North Cornwall Groundwater         North Cornwall #> 3769 GB40802G800200 South Cornwall Groundwater         South Cornwall #> 3772 GB40802G800100  West Cornwall Groundwater          West Cornwall #>                   MC        RBD #> 3544 South West TraC South West #> 3567 South West TraC South West #> 3763   South West GW South West #> 3769   South West GW South West #> 3772   South West GW South West
